title: rahulzx
author: rahulzx
content: I have seen that there are a number of Hero and Legendary members here on this forum. I assume that you all done at least one mistake when you actively participating in the forum. comments.author: Daniel91
comments.body: I'm not sure you'll get many honest answers here  None of us want to talk about our mistakes in public, as you know.However, I will still admit one of my mistakes, which is a personal conflict with a prominent member of the forum, which took place publicly, so that it was visible to everyone.Each of us felt that he was right and did not want to give up, but in fact it would be much better if we could resolve our misunderstandings privately, outside of the forum.We should try to avoid personal conflicts on the forum and in public, so that the forum remains a place for the crypto community to socialize and exchange useful information and opinions.

comments.body: Quote from: rahulzx on April 08, 2023, 12:48:05 PMIf you would like to share a mistake you have made, it could help newcomers avoid making the same mistake when posting here.To trust a few users who had some positive ratings [mostly from DT2 users] to pay once I'm done delivering the work [I'm not implying that none of those who have positive ratings can be trusted, but if you can use escrow services, it'd be better (or at least have some respect for what you'll be doing and go with the 50-50 term)]!Note: Back then, we had a slightly different trust system.

comments.author: 2double0
comments.body: The most stupid mistake a person would do here is by saving their password to this forum, on their PC or phone.I believe that such sensitive data should never be kept on devices that remain online whole day and are vulnerable to malicious attacks which could lead to your account being compromised here. I did that mistake once, and thought that my account got compromised. But it didn't, and I immediately changed my password to a new, stronger and longer string to let hackers take years to get into my account.

comments.body: During my early days I got a 1 or 2 week ban for low quality posts for a sig campaign I joined. At the time I barely knew anything about the forum and had not taken the time to learn any of the rules. If there is anything a newbie should do, it's read the RULES and the stickies in each section.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: My biggest mistake is not being heavier on the ignore button.  I always tried to respond to questions and concerns about my activities, but there came a point where trolls and scammers used this attempt to maintain truth about my activities as a way to try and elevate themselves in the community.  It didn't matter what lies they told or how many alt accounts they had to burn making ridiculous claims, they just wanted attention and to damage my reputation by any means possible.  I see now that engaging with them only 'got them off' and even after some of them have been ignored for years, they still try their best to gain my attention with whatever lies they think the ignorant will believe.  Just hit the ignore button on trolls.  They outnumber contributing members to Bitcoin here 100 to 1 and with the trust network being a popularity contest to inflate trust for potential scams (see ColdKey scam) it is clear the train has gone off the rails and the inmates are running the asylum.  All you have to do is look at the DT1 members that still include Vod in their trust networks after Vod openly tried to extort me on this forum.  Truth is something here that literally doesn't matter anymore.  Don't fight for it.  It's a losing battle that will only negatively reflect against you here until those running this forum get their heads out of their ass.

I never seem to be able to find enough time to do as much as I would want to and hope to find the perfect balance between the forum and other engagements one has.- Jay -
